definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: He stretched himself on her threshold and uttered his complaints to the cruel bolts and bars .
sentences.chinese: 他匍伏在她門檻上對着冷酷無情的插銷門栓傾訴哀怨。

sentences.english: The pilgrims prostrated themselves before the altar.
sentences.chinese: 朝聖者都匍伏在聖壇前。

sentences.english: Study on feed value of creeping type of Astragalus adsurgens Pall.
sentences.chinese: 野生匍伏型沙打旺飼用價值的研究。

definition: to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to curl up/to lie curled up
